**Step-by-Step Explanation:**

1. **Identify Passivating Molecules:**
   - The text discusses several CPMs used as passivating molecules, including In-BTC, Zn-BTC, Zn-cbpp, Zr-MOFs (UiO-66 and MOF-808), Ti-MOFs, Zn-MOFs, and ZIF-8.

2. **Performance Data:**
   - **In-BTC:** Increases PCE from 18.19% to 19.63%.
   - **Zn-BTC:** Improves PCE to 19.63 ± 1.24%.
   - **Zn-cbpp:** Enhances PCE to 21.28%.
   - **Zr-MOFs (UiO-66 and MOF-808):** Increase PCE to 18.01% and 17.81%.
   - **Ti-MOFs:** Improve PCE compared to commercial TiO2.
   - **Zn-MOFs:** Enhance PCE with better electron transport.
   - **ZIF-8:** Reduces recombination and improves interface contact, leading to higher PCE.

3. **Stability Data:**
   - **Li-TFSI@NH2-MIL-101:** Retains over 85% PCE after 3600 hours.

4. **JSON Structure:**
   - Since the text doesn't specify a single champion passivator, the passivating molecule field remains null.
   - Stability test data is included under `test_1` with the inferred test type and parameters.

title: Supplementary Text 1 Preparation and characterizations of HEHP single crystals Single crystals of 4/6/8/10/12C HEHP were prepared by dissolving PbI2, BAI, HAI, OAI, DAI and DDAI in gamma-butyrolactone followed by an anti-solvent diffusion method. To remove the organic cations that are not involved into the structure of the HEHP, the single crystals were washed by diethyl ether for more than three times and dried in a vacuum chamber overnight. X-ray diffraction measurement for HEHP compounds was collected at 170 K, performed on a Bruker D8 Venture diffractometer with PHOTON III detector in shutter-less mode with an incoatec microfocus source (Mo-Diamond Kα radiation, λ= 0.71073 Å) and an Oxford 800 Plus liquid nitrogen vapor cooling device. The computing indexing, cell refinement and data reduction on HEHP compounds was processed using APEX3 software. Frame integration, including Lorentz-polarization corrections, and final cell-parameter calculations were carried out with SAINT software. The data were corrected for absorption with SADABS program. Structures were solved using direct methods with SHELXT 1 , subsequent difference Fourier calculations and full-matrix least-squares refinement against F 2 were performed with SHELXL 1-2 . All non-hydrogen atoms were refined with anisotropic displacement parameters. Hydrogen atoms were inserted in calculated positions and refined with a riding model. Crystal data, data collection parameters, and structure refinement details are given in Table S5-S10. Refinement Details. Refinement of F 2 against all reflections. The weighted R-factor wR and goodness of fit S are based on F 2 , conventional R-factors R are based on F, with F set to zero for negative F 2 . The threshold expression of F 2 > 2sigma(F 2 ) is used only for calculating R-factors(gt) etc. and is not relevant to the choice of reflections for refinement. R-factors based on F 2 are statistically about twice as large as those based on F, and Rfactors based on all data will be even larger

title: Precursor Solution Preparation: PbI 2 , MAI, PDMA, and PDMAI 2 were separately dissolved in DMF with a concentration of 500 mg mL -1 . For the self-generated MA gas treatment (SG-MA) method, AMA n-1 Pb n I 3n+1 (A=PDMA) perovskite precursor solution was prepared by mixing A: MAI: PbI 2 with a molar ratio of 1: n+1: n. Additive MACl was first dissolved in PbI 2 /DMF solution at 65 ℃, then MAI solution and A were mixed before adding into PbI 2 + MACl solution. For the control method, AMA n-1 Pb n I 3n+1 (A 2+ =PDMA 2+ ) perovskite precursor solution was prepared by mixing AI 2 : MAI: PbI with a molar ratio of 1: n-1: n. Additives MACl was first dissolved in PbI 2 /DMF solution at 65 ℃, then AI 2 solution was into PbI 2 + MACl solution. The quasi-2D DJ perovskite precursor solution was aged for 30 minutes before use

{2-(3,6-diiodo-9H-carbazol-9yl)ethyl}phosphonic acid (I-2PACz). 

The text states that the I-2PACz SAM was used to replace the 2PACz SAM. It mentions that this change increased the interfacial mechanical adhesion by 2.6-fold. The I-2PACz SAM has iodine termination, which affects the bonding with the MHP, leading to better mechanical adhesion and operational stability.

Looking for performance data, the text says that the PSCs with I-2PACz SAM achieved a maximum power conversion efficiency (PCE) of 25.39%. After 1000 hours of continuous illumination, the PCE retained 96.3%. The text also discusses the stability tests, such as the DCB (double cantilever beam) test, which measures the interfacial adhesion toughness. The I-2PACz SAM resulted in a higher adhesion toughness of 1.29 ± 0.28 J/m² compared to 0.49 ± 0.14 J/m² for 2PACz.

There are also SEM images showing that the I-2PACz SAM prevents the formation of pores and cracks, which improves the operational stability. The text mentions that the T80 (time to retain 80% PCE) for the I-2PACz-treated cells is 4062 hours, compared to 663 hours for the 2PACz-treated cells.

So, the passivating molecule in this study is I-2PACz. The key performance data include PCE of 25.39%, retained PCE of 96.3% after 1000 hours, and a T80 of 4062 hours. The mechanical adhesion increased from 0.49 to 1.29 J/m², and the SEM showed better quality of the MHP film with I-2PACz.

I need to structure this into a JSON object as per the guidelines. The passivating molecule is I-2PACz. The PCE is 25.39%, retained PCE is 96.3%, T80 is 4062 hours.
